descriptions.loadBalancer: Short TTL for quick failover capability

errors.mustBePositive: TTL must be a positive number

tradeoffs.title: TTL Trade-offs
tradeoffs.content: Lower TTLs allow faster propagation of DNS changes but increase DNS query load. Higher TTLs reduce DNS traffic but slow down change propagation. Balance based on your needs.

cacheBehavior.title: Cache Behavior
cacheBehavior.content: DNS resolvers cache records for the TTL duration. Once expired, they must query authoritative servers again. Some resolvers may cache slightly longer or shorter than the exact TTL.

changePlanning.title: Change Planning
changePlanning.content: Before making DNS changes, consider lowering TTLs in advance. This reduces the time users see old records. After changes stabilize, you can increase TTLs again.

monitoringImpact.title: Monitoring Impact
monitoringImpact.content: Monitor DNS query volumes when changing TTLs. Very short TTLs can significantly increase load on authoritative servers and may impact DNS provider costs.
